data.enText: to try to make sb believe that you will do sth that you do not really intend to do, or that you know sth that you do not really know

data.chText: 我认为他不会开枪——我想他不过是在吓唬人。
data.enText: I don't think he'll shoot─I think he's just bluffing.
bluff sb into doing sth
to make sb do sth by tricking them, especially by pretending you have more experience, knowledge, etc. than you really have
bluff it out

data.chText: （受到怀疑后）继续蒙混过关，靠说谎摆脱困境
data.enText: to get out of a difficult situation by continuing to tell lies, especially when they suspect you are not being honest
bluff your way in/out/through
bluff your way into/out of/through sth
to succeed in dealing with a difficult situation by making other people believe sth which is not true

data.chText: 她胡乱吹嘘，成功地通过了面试。
data.enText: She successfully bluffed her way through the interview.
an attempt to trick sb by making them believe that you will do sth when you really have no intention of doing it, or that you know sth when you do not, in fact, know it

data.chText: 那只不过是唬人的把戏。
data.enText: It was just a game of bluff.

data.chText: 他说如果不给他加薪他就辞职，但那不过是虚张声势而已。
data.enText: He said he would resign if he didn't get more money, but it was only a bluff.

data.chText: （尤指海边或河边的）峭壁，陡岸
data.enText: a steep cliff or slope, especially by the sea or a river
call sb's bluff

data.chText: 要求…摊牌，要求…兑现其恫吓（因相信对方不至于或不敢这样做）
data.enText: to tell sb to do what they are threatening to do, because you believe that they will not be cruel or brave enough to do it

data.chText: 直率豪爽的（尽管有时不够礼貌）
data.enText: very direct and cheerful, with good intentions, although not always very polite

data.chText: 他外表大大咧咧，但其实是个敏感的人。
data.enText: Beneath his bluff exterior he was a sensitive man.

means: (尤指海边或河边的)峭壁，陡岸
直率豪爽的(尽管有时不够礼貌)

data.enText: call sb's bluff

data.chText: 要求…摊牌，要求…兑现其恫吓（因相信对方不至于或不敢这样做）
data.enText: to tell sb to do what they are threatening to do, because you believe that they will not be cruel or brave enough to do it
bluff sb into doing sth
to make sb do sth by tricking them, especially by pretending you have more experience, knowledge, etc. than you really have
bluff it out

data.chText: （受到怀疑后）继续蒙混过关，靠说谎摆脱困境
data.enText: to get out of a difficult situation by continuing to tell lies, especially when they suspect you are not being honest
bluff your way in/out/through
bluff your way into/out of/through sth
to succeed in dealing with a difficult situation by making other people believe sth which is not true

data.chText: 她胡乱吹嘘，成功地通过了面试。
data.enText: She successfully bluffed her way through the interview.

tr: the act of bluffing in poker
deception by a false show of confidence in the strength of your cards
pretense that your position is stronger than it really is
example: his bluff succeeded in getting him accepted

tr: a high steep bank (usually formed by river erosion)
frighten someone by pretending to be stronger than one really is
deceive an opponent by a bold bet on an inferior hand with the result that the opponent withdraws a winning hand
bluntly direct and outspoken but good-natured
example: a bluff and rugged natural leader

tr: having a prominent and almost vertical front
example: where the bold chalk cliffs of England rise

value.def: A bluff is an attempt to make someone believe that you will do something when you do not really intend to do it.

example.tran: 这封信不过是吓唬人罢了。

example.ex: It is essential to build up the military option and show that this is not a bluff...
example.tran: 关键是要做好采取军事行动的准备，以表明这不是虚张声势。

example.ex: What we're at here is a game of bluff.
example.tran: 我们此时陷入的是一场骗局。

value.tran: 欺骗；误导；吓唬；虚张声势

value.def: If you call someone's bluff, you tell them to do what they have been threatening to do, because you are sure that they will not really do it.

example.ex: The Socialists have decided to call the opposition's bluff.
example.tran: 社会党人已经决定接受对方的挑战。

value.tran: （因料到对方不敢行动而）要求…摊牌，接受…的挑战

value.def: If you bluff, you make someone believe that you will do something when you do not really intend to do it, or that you know something when you do not really know it.

example.ex: Either side, or both, could be bluffing...
example.tran: 任何一方，或者双方，都可能是在故弄玄虚。

example.ex: In each case the hijackers bluffed the crew using fake grenades...
example.tran: 每一个案例中，劫机者都用了假手榴弹吓唬机组人员。

example.ex: He tried to bluff his way through another test and failed it.
example.tran: 他试图再次在考试中蒙混过关，但却露馅了。

value.tran: 欺骗；误导；吓唬；虚张声势

value.def: A bluff is a steep cliff or bank, especially by a river or the sea.

example.ex: ...a high bluff over the Congaree River.
example.tran: 康加里河边高耸的峭壁

value.tran: （尤指河边或海边的）悬崖，峭壁，陡岸

value.def: If you describe someone, usually a man, as bluff, you mean that they have a very direct way of speaking and behaving.

example.ex: He comes across as a man with a bluff exterior who, beyond that, is difficult to get to know...
example.tran: 他给人感觉是一个直来直去的人，但内心却让人捉摸不透。

example.ex: He has continued to write with a bluff, vivid humour about Yorkshire life.
example.tran: 他继续用一种直白而又诙谐生动的笔触描绘着约克郡的生活。

trans: （因料到对方不敢行动而）要求…摊牌，接受…的挑战
虚实并用的诈骗(以实相告而期望对方以为有诈)
